metadata.title: Layout and organization | Apple Developer Documentation
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: This is an Apple Developer Documentation page presenting the 'Layout and organization' section of the Human Interface Guidelines. The page serves as a navigation hub displaying 10 component categories (Boxes, Collections, Column views, Disclosure controls, Labels, Lists and tables, Lockups, Outline views, Split views, Tab views) with visual card-style thumbnails for each. The page includes comprehensive site navigation, footer links, and theme switching controls.
metadata.copyright: Copyright 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

content.description: A card-style thumbnail showing a visual representation of the Boxes component. The illustration depicts a coral/salmon colored rounded rectangle container with three smaller rounded rectangle placeholder elements inside arranged horizontally. Each inner element has an image placeholder icon (mountain/landscape symbol) suggesting photo or media content. The overall design suggests a content box or card container pattern.
content.composition: One large coral-colored rounded rectangle container with three smaller light coral/pink rounded rectangles arranged horizontally inside, each containing a simplified mountain/photo icon
content.technicalDetails: Simplified UI component illustration representing a box/card container
content.contextualRelevance: Visual representation of the Boxes component category - containers that group related content

content.description: A card-style thumbnail showing a visual representation of the Collections component. The illustration shows a coral/salmon colored rounded rectangle container with four smaller rounded rectangle image placeholders arranged in a 2x2 grid pattern. Each placeholder has a simplified mountain/landscape photo icon, suggesting a photo gallery or media collection layout.
content.composition: One coral-colored rounded rectangle container with four light coral/pink rounded rectangles arranged in a 2x2 grid, each containing a mountain/photo icon
content.technicalDetails: Simplified UI component illustration representing a collection/gallery layout
content.contextualRelevance: Visual representation of the Collections component category - grid-based layouts for displaying multiple items

content.description: A card-style thumbnail showing a visual representation of Column views. The illustration depicts a multi-column navigation interface typical of macOS Finder or similar file browsers. The left column shows three folder items (Folder A highlighted in blue, Folder B highlighted in coral/salmon, Folder C in coral) with folder icons. A chevron arrow indicates the selected item. The right column shows five image items (Image A through Image E) with image icons in coral/red color, representing the contents of the selected folder.
content.composition: Two-column layout: left column with three folder rows (Folder A, B, C), middle column divider with chevron, right column with five image rows (Image A-E). Selected item (Folder B) highlighted in coral/salmon.
content.technicalDetails: Depicts macOS-style column view file browser pattern
content.contextualRelevance: Visual representation of Column views component - hierarchical multi-column navigation pattern

content.description: A card-style thumbnail showing a visual representation of Disclosure controls. The illustration shows a coral/salmon colored rounded rectangle container with two disclosure control indicators: a right-pointing chevron (>) on the left indicating collapsed/expandable content, and a downward-pointing chevron (v) on the right indicating expanded content. Both chevrons are displayed in white against the coral background.
content.composition: Coral-colored rounded rectangle with two white chevron icons - one pointing right (collapsed state) on the left side, one pointing down (expanded state) on the right side
content.technicalDetails: Illustrates the two states of disclosure controls - collapsed (right chevron) and expanded (down chevron)
content.contextualRelevance: Visual representation of Disclosure controls - UI elements that expand/collapse content sections

content.description: A card-style thumbnail showing a visual representation of Labels. The illustration shows a coral/salmon colored rounded rectangle container with the word 'Label' displayed prominently in white text at the center. This represents a basic text label UI component.
content.composition: Coral-colored rounded rectangle with centered white text reading 'Label'
content.technicalDetails: Simple illustration of a text label component
content.contextualRelevance: Visual representation of Labels component - text elements that describe or identify other UI elements

content.description: A card-style thumbnail showing a visual representation of Lists and tables. The illustration shows a white/light background card with three table rows. Each row contains text on the left ('Table Row 1', 'Table Row 2', 'Table Row 3') and a right-pointing chevron (disclosure indicator) on the right side. The rows have a coral/salmon colored border on the left edge and coral chevrons, indicating tappable/selectable list items with navigation capability.
content.composition: Rounded rectangle card with three horizontal rows stacked vertically. Each row has left-aligned text and right-aligned coral chevron. Left border accent in coral color.
content.technicalDetails: Standard iOS/Apple table view pattern with disclosure indicators
content.contextualRelevance: Visual representation of Lists and tables component - vertical arrangements of rows with optional navigation

content.description: A card-style thumbnail showing a visual representation of Lockups. The illustration shows a coral/salmon colored rounded rectangle container with a lockup component inside. The lockup contains a circular image placeholder (with mountain/photo icon) on the left, and two lines of text on the right: 'Line 1 (Headline)' as the primary text and 'Line 2 (Footnote)' as secondary text in a smaller, lighter style. This represents a standard lockup pattern combining an image with descriptive text.
content.composition: Coral rounded rectangle containing a circular avatar/image placeholder on left with two lines of white text to the right (headline above, footnote below)
content.technicalDetails: Standard lockup pattern used in tvOS and other Apple platforms
content.contextualRelevance: Visual representation of Lockups component - combined image and text elements that work as a unit

content.description: A card-style thumbnail showing a visual representation of Outline views. The illustration shows a hierarchical file/folder structure typical of an outline or tree view. At the top is 'Folder A' (expanded, indicated by down chevron) containing 'Image A', 'Image B', 'Image C' as child items. Below is 'Folder B' (collapsed, indicated by right chevron). Each item shows folder or image icons in coral/blue colors. Date stamps are shown on the right side of each row (6/6/22, 6/6/22, 6/5/22, 5/12/22, 10/20/21).
content.composition: Vertical list with hierarchical indentation. Folder A expanded showing three image children, Folder B collapsed. Each row has icon, name, and date.
content.technicalDetails: macOS-style outline view with expandable folders and file details
content.contextualRelevance: Visual representation of Outline views - hierarchical tree structures with expandable/collapsible nodes

content.description: A card-style thumbnail showing a visual representation of Split views. The illustration shows a coral/salmon colored rounded rectangle container that appears empty or minimally styled with a subtle three-dot indicator (ellipsis) in the upper right area, suggesting a split view divider handle or options control. The mostly empty space represents the two panes of a split view interface.
content.composition: Coral rounded rectangle with minimal internal detail, three-dot ellipsis indicator in upper right suggesting split control
content.technicalDetails: Represents split view component for side-by-side content display
content.contextualRelevance: Visual representation of Split views - two-pane layouts that can be resized

content.description: A card-style thumbnail showing a visual representation of Tab views. The illustration shows a coral/salmon colored rounded rectangle container with a segmented control or tab bar near the top. The tab bar has a lighter coral/pink pill-shaped indicator showing the currently selected tab, positioned to the right of center, suggesting tab navigation between different content views.
content.composition: Coral rounded rectangle with a horizontal tab bar/segmented control near the top, showing a lighter pill-shaped selection indicator
content.technicalDetails: Represents tab view component for switching between content sections
content.contextualRelevance: Visual representation of Tab views - interfaces that allow switching between different content areas

pages.pageSummary: This page is the 'Layout and organization' section of Apple's Human Interface Guidelines, serving as a navigation hub for 10 UI component categories. The page displays a 3-column grid of card-style thumbnails (Boxes, Collections, Column views, Disclosure controls, Labels, Lists and tables, Lockups, Outline views, Split views, Tab views), each with an illustrative preview image and label. The page includes comprehensive site navigation in the header, a collapsible sidebar menu on the left, and an extensive footer with links to all Apple developer resources, programs, and support options.

crossPageElements.runningHeaders: Apple Developer navigation bar with News, Discover, Design, Develop, Distribute, Support, Account
crossPageElements.runningFooters: Footer with Platforms, Tools, Topics & Technologies, Resources, Support, Account, Programs, Events sections

sections.title: Site Navigation

subsections.title: Primary Header
subsections.description: Main site navigation with Apple Developer branding

sections.summary: Comprehensive navigation system including primary header, secondary Design-specific navigation, and collapsible sidebar with full documentation hierarchy

sections.title: Layout and organization Components
sections.summary: Grid of 10 UI component categories for organizing and laying out content in Apple platform applications

sections.title: Site Footer
sections.summary: Comprehensive footer with links to all Apple developer platforms, tools, technologies, resources, support, programs, and events

semanticStructure.documentFlow: The page follows a standard Apple documentation layout: header navigation at top, collapsible sidebar on left for documentation hierarchy navigation, main content area displaying the 10 Layout and organization component categories in a visual card grid format, and comprehensive footer at bottom. The content is organized as a navigation hub allowing users to drill into specific component documentation.

keyTerms.definition: A category of UI components in Apple's Human Interface Guidelines focused on structuring and arranging content within applications
Container components that group related content together
Grid-based layouts for displaying multiple items, such as photos or media
Multi-column hierarchical navigation pattern, as seen in macOS Finder
UI controls (chevrons) that expand or collapse content sections
Text elements that describe or identify other UI elements
Vertical arrangements of rows for displaying content with optional navigation
Combined image and text elements that work as a unit, common in tvOS
Hierarchical tree structures with expandable/collapsible nodes
Two-pane layouts that can be resized by the user
Interfaces that allow switching between different content areas using tabs
Apple's official design documentation for creating apps across their platforms
Reusable UI building blocks in Apple's design system

keyFindings: Apple organizes layout and organization components into 10 distinct categories
Visual card-based navigation provides quick visual identification of each component type
The component categories span all Apple platforms: iOS, iPadOS, macOS, tvOS, visionOS, and watchOS
Disclosure controls use chevron icons to indicate expand/collapse state
Column views follow the macOS Finder navigation pattern
Lockups combine image and text elements as a single interactive unit
The page serves as a navigation hub rather than containing detailed documentation
Apple uses a consistent coral/salmon (#F97066) color theme for component illustrations

designDecisions.rationale: Allows users to quickly identify component types through illustrative previews
Efficient use of space while maintaining scannability
Provides hierarchical access to all documentation while allowing focus on main content
Creates visual consistency across component previews while being distinct from UI chrome

footerLegal: To submit feedback on documentation, visit Feedback Assistant.
Copyright 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

themeToggle.function: Switch between light mode, dark mode, or auto (system preference)
